title: The Oxford handbook of Italian politics
subject: Italy -- Politics and government -- 1945-1976
Italy -- Politics and government -- 1976-1994
Italy -- Politics and government -- 1994-2018
Italie -- Politique et gouvernement -- 1945-1976
Italie -- Politique et gouvernement -- 1976-1994
Italie -- Politique et gouvernement -- 1994-2018
Politics and government
Italy
description: This volume covers every aspect of Italian political life from core concepts through key personalities, political traditions, historical periods, civil society actors, social dynamics, and external relations.
contents: La Classe Dirigente / James Newell -- The Risorgimento / Anthony L. Cardoza -- Trasformismo / Marco Valbruzzi -- Partitocracy / Maurizio Cotta -- A Tale of Two Italys? The "Southern Question" Past and Present / John A. Davis -- The Constitution / Giuliano Amato -- The Presidents of the Republic / Gianfranco Pasquino -- Government and Prime Minister / Mauro Calise -- Parliament / Salvatore Vassallo -- The Courts / Carlo Antonio Guarnieri Calbo Crotta -- Electoral Systems / Marta Regalia -- Party Systems in Post-World War II Italy / Carol Mershon -- Bureaucracy / Simona Piattoni -- Christian Democracy / Gianfranco Baldini -- Communists / Paolo Bellucci -- Socialists, Republicans, and Radicals / Nicolò Conti -- Fascists and Post-fascists / Piero Ignazi -- Populism and the Lega Nord / Gianluca Passarelli -- Liberalism and Liberals / Giovanni Orsina -- Christian Democracy in Power, 1946-1963 / Paolo Pombeni -- The "Opening to the Left" / Ilaria Favretto -- The Compromesso Storico / Stephen Hellman -- The Pentapartito / Martin J. Bull -- Tangentopoli--More than 20 Years on / Martin Rhodes -- Bipolarity (and After) / Jonathan Hopkin -- Alcide De Gasperi and Palmiro Togliatti / Aldo Agosti -- Gianni Agnelli and Enrico Mattei / Valerio Castronovo -- Aldo Moro and Enrico Berlinguer / Emanuele Bernardi -- Bettino Craxi and Giulio Andreotti / Antonio Varsori -- Silvio Berlusconi and Romano Prodi / Mark Donovan, Mark Gilbert -- The Italian Catholic Hierarchy / Alberto Melloni -- The Catholic Right / Paolo Acanfora -- Religious Differentiation and New Religions in Italy / Roberto Cipriani, Verónica Roldán -- The Laity / Massimo Teodori -- Trends and Tensions within the Italian Family / Chiara Saraceno -- Industry and the Firm / Giuseppe Berta -- Labor Market Policy and Politics / Patrick Vesan -- The Welfare State / Maurizio Ferrera, Matteo Jessoula -- The Bank of Italy / Lucia Quaglia -- Trade Unions / Marino Regini -- Liberal and Licensed Professions / Carlo Carboni -- The Cooperative Movement / Vera Negri Zamagni -- Cinema and Television / Stephen Gundle -- The Press / Paolo Mancini -- The Intellectuals / Nadia Urbinati -- Public Ethics and Political Corruption in Italy / David Hine -- Women in Politics / Donatella Campus -- Immigration / Giuseppe Sciortino -- Social Movements / Donatella Della Porta -- Terrorist Movements / Anna Cento Bull -- Mafia, Camorra, and 'Ndrangheta / Letizia Paoli -- Italy and the Atlantic Alliance / Mario Del Pero -- Gli Esami Non Finiscono Mai / Vincent Della Sala -- Italy and the Mediterranean after World War II / Roberto Aliboni.

abstract: This volume covers every aspect of Italian political life from core concepts through key personalities, political traditions, historical periods, civil society actors, social dynamics, and external relations.
btitle: The Oxford handbook of Italian politics
